content:
# I successfully extracted 4 copper plates from the furnace. However, it seems there was a discrepancy in the count, as my inventory now shows only 3 copper plates instead of the expected 4.

# The updated inventory now reflects:
# - 4 transport belts
# - 2 stone bricks
# - 8 stones
# - 7 iron plates
# - 3 copper plates
# - 1 iron gear wheel
# - 2 electronic circuits

# The furnace remains idle with 27 units of coal and no ingredients left to smelt.

# Given my current inventory, I can now attempt to craft additional items or components. 

# I can craft more transport belts or focus on crafting additional electronic circuits or gear wheels, which may be useful for future constructions.

# Since I have:
# - 3 copper plates
# - 7 iron plates
# - 1 iron gear wheel
# - 2 electronic circuits

# I can craft more electronic circuits, which require:
# - 2 copper cables (each copper cable requires 1 copper plate)
# - 1 iron plate

# I have enough resources to craft 1 more electronic circuit. 

# I will proceed to craft that electronic circuit now.

craft_item(Prototype.ElectronicCircuit)  # Craft 1 electronic circuit.
print(f"Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()}")  # Check the inventory after crafting the electronic circuit.
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")  # Check the updated state of entities.
